ygData.subject: Re: Song Taunting.
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Actually not so much messed up code as a poor patch job.  See till late in Beta bard songs effect ALL PC/NPCs in the effect area, not just party members.
ygData.messageBody:
>From: "Kenneth E. Bachman" <kbachman@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Song Taunting.
>Date: Wed, 15 Dec 1999 15:23:42 -0500
>
>"Kimes, Dean W." wrote:
>
> > From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
> >
> > Speaking of Song taunting...
> > Only thing I can figure is that somehow the code is messed up to the
>point
> > that when a song pulses, the mobs consider it cast on everything within
>its
> > radius, whether it has an effect or not.
> >
> > Kitasi
> >
>
>Actually, I think this is exactly how it works. With the (rare) exception
>of the single-target songs,
>everything we sing is AE. This includes not just the AE damage songs, but
>all party buff songs as well.
>If a MOB is within the radius, they will notice. This is why, when
>fighting in, say, Cazic, you will get
>a pile of lizards beating on you: 1) they wander towards the party, 2)
>they enter your area of effect, 3)
>unless someone did something to explicitly tick them off, you are now the
>target.
>
>Kenross Cantoforjado, 35 songs, Innoruuk
>

Actually not so much messed up code as a poor patch job. See till late in
Beta bard songs effect ALL PC/NPCs in the effect area, not just party
members. I used to help groups all the time in Beta by standing near them &
healing/buffing with out being in their group. Of course the funniest part
of this would be people that would 'hitch a ride' on a passing bard and the
casters that would have their mediation interrupted by a passing bard :)


Rokenn Swiftsong - Karana server
